TopicTitle: The Saga of Emiko Station - Complete

Articles.Content: Something's come up... I'm going to have to take a break for a few days. Sorry.

5 hours ago, Just Jim said:

Something's come up... I'm going to have to take a break for a few days. Sorry. 

It's ok. Hope whatever is happening gets resolved

6 hours ago, Just Jim said:

Something's come up... I'm going to have to take a break for a few days. Sorry. 

Well, I hope it's not something bad happening to anything or anybody you care about, but that it pays double overtime.

It's OK, I just something have something I have to take care of... RL kind of stuff.

I'll be back next week, promise.
@Just Jim, you're pinned for this months TOTM

3 hours ago, sal_vager said:

@Just Jim, you're pinned for this months TOTM

You really know how to pick 'em, ya know
TOTM! Yeah Jim! Whoo! What a love-fest you'll return to when you get back to the thread, congrats!
Congrats on the TOTM!

Great news - grats Jim!

A well deserved sticky if ever there was one!

I feel guilty for avoding this post, well... Actually, I've been avoiding the whole forums mainly because of this post. Don't get me wrong, this story is amazing, I've just been focusing more on school and real life so I've been resisting the urge to return here. The fact that you see this post means I couldn't hold it anymore, screw my grades, im getting back to KSP.

Anyways, loving the direction the story is taking and I'm having a bit of trouble understanding it so I'm going to have to read the few chapters again until I get it. Also congrats on the TOTM thing, was a bit surprised to not find it at the bottom of the list but instead at the top. Definitely staying on the forums a bit longer now because of this amazing piece of writing.
I believe @Just Jim might be prepping a special chapter in lieu of TOTM.

Oh wow,  take off a couple days, and look what y'all went and did!  hehe

1 hour ago, SpaceplaneAddict said:

I believe @Just Jim might be prepping a special chapter in lieu of TOTM.

It looks like I'm going to have to now... 

That's cool.  Having a few days off gave me time to let my mind wander and come up with a couple new twists.

I'll be done with stupid reality by this weekend, promise.  Then I can get back to my Kerbal-verse!

No worries about the lack of dramatic tension this chapter....It makes a great interlude watching Kerbals do what they do best! Great to see the kids already trusted with helping raze the old tower, showing them doing what KIDS do best! Besides being too cute for words.....!   Congratulations on TOTM!

@Just Jim, Excellent job on this story!

Not gonna go back to quote you, but you said [much] earlier on this thread that no one could reproduce this story because Squad owns KSP. I say you should have SQUAD publish it and pay you royalties!

Can't wait for the next chapter!

-Jeb!

Great to see the kids already trusted with helping raze the old tower, showing them doing what KIDS do best! Besides being too cute for words.....!   Congratulations on TOTM! 

Really?  I'm not going to lie, after I went back and read it, I thought my last chapter was kind of...well,  blehhhhh.  The station itself looks amazing (I think...lol), but the rest of it kind of fell flat.  IMO, I need to crank up the tension.

As for Squad publishing it and paying me... well, when they become a multi-million dollar company, I'll start looking for my royalty checks...

1 hour ago, Just Jim said:

As for Squad publishing it and paying me... well, when they become a multi-million dollar company, I'll start looking for my royalty checks... 

Well, (one), they are a multi-million dollar company-- and (two), since we're all writing fiction using characters, images and situations to which SQUAD holds the rights--nope, no checks. Not even 'early access' . 

However, I once heard about a fanfic on a forum for the Twilight books, and the author changed the names and made the characters humans instead of werebears and sparkly vampires or whatever, and published a book, which based on the title I assume had to do with an unexpectedly broad range of monochromatic paint options. So, you could always go that route

7 hours ago, Andem said:

Ahhhhhh, but after all this.... 20,000+ views and TOTM... No-one has thought to ask, or try to find out, just who Emiko really was!

It's the one shout-out I did that no-one has gotten yet.... 

 

Edited March 5, 2016 by Just Jim

12 minutes ago, Just Jim said:

Ahhhhhh, but after all this.... 20,000+ views and TOTM... No-one has thought to ask, or try to find out, just who Emiko really was!

Actually, I did some research. Mainly because the name "Emiko" peaked my interest as it was the name of an active member on a graphic design forum I frequently visit. Figuring it wouldn't be that Emiko I googled it, but I didn't get any further than a Japanese singer. You claimed it was named after your grandmother though, if I'm not mistaken...

From Wiki: Personally, I think it's the retired badminton player.

People[edit]

  • Emiko Kado (門 恵美子, 1976-1999), Japanese professional wrestler
  • Emiko Miyamoto (宮本 恵美子, born 1937), Japanese volleyball player who competed in the 1964 Summer Olympics
  • Emiko Odaka (小高 笑子, born 1962), former Japanese volleyball player competed in the 1984 Summer Olympics where she won a bronze medal
  • Emiko Ohnuki-Tierney, American anthropologist
  • Emiko Raika (来家 恵美子, born 1975), Japanese professional boxer
  • Emiko Shinohara (篠原 恵美子, born 1963), a Japanese voice actress who has voiced many well known anime characters including Sailor Jupiter in Sailor Moon R: The Movie, and Sailor Moon S: The Movie, and Kaho Mizuki in Cardcaptor Sakura
  • Emiko Shiratori (白鳥 英美子, born 1950), Japanese singer and songwriter
  • Emiko Suzuki (鈴木 絵美子, born 1981), a synchronized swimmer from Saitama, Japan who competed in both the 2004, and the 2008 Summer Olympics
  • Emiko Uematsu (植松 恵美子, born 1967), Japanese politician of the Democratic Party of Japan and a member of the House of Councillors in the Diet
  • Emiko Ueno (植野恵美子, born 1957), retired Japanese female badminton player

Fictional characters[edit]

  • Emiko Niwa (丹羽 笑子), a fictional character from the Japanese manga series D.N.Angel
  • Emiko Yamane (山根 恵美子), a character in the 1954 film Godzilla
  • Emiko, a main character in the science fiction novel The Windup Girl
Well, given the disastrous themes in the Emiko Saga, we could also go for the Godzilla character!

Nope.... not the badminton player, but the correct one is listed in that!

Think carefully about me, how I write, and build ships... it's a hard one, but I think the clues are there.

Figuring it wouldn't be that Emiko I googled it, but I didn't get any further than a Japanese singer. You claimed it was named after your grandmother though, if I'm not mistaken...

 

Close... I said it was named for Val's grandmother, who claimed to have actually seen a live Kraken when she was young... 

Hint: this is a clue to it happening many years ago.....
